intro: Calandrinia armeriifolia, commonly known as the silverleaf morning glory, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its delicate, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and violet. The plant has small, silver-gray leaves that are covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in dry, rocky habitats. Calandrinia armeriifolia is a member of the nightshade family and is known for its rapid growth and ability to bloom throughout the growing season.
